update.title: Issue#139 gazebo ros shutdown

content.html:
I like this idea. Very clear and works. I think we need to also add UpdateTaskMessage() before publishing, or else the taskMsg would be the same as the previous one. That way, as soon as it is finished, it will update task message, publish, then exit.

//////////////////////////////////////////////////
void ScoringPlugin::PublishStats()
{
  this->UpdateTaskMessage();

  // We publish stats at 1Hz.
  if (this->currentTime - this->lastStatsSent >= gazebo::common::Time(1, 0))
  {
    this->taskPub.publish(this->taskMsg);
    this->lastStatsSent = this->currentTime;
  }
}

Essentially, I think we want this code to remain as is to always publish at 1 Hz, but when OnFinished is called, run this without the if statement.

update.title: Issue#139 gazebo ros shutdown

content.raw: From my understanding, the times to complete tasks shouldn’t be super close, so like 10Hz isn’t crazy fast, but allows for about \+/-0.05s accuracy. Thoughts?
content.html: From my understanding, the times to complete tasks shouldn’t be super close, so like 10Hz isn’t crazy fast, but allows for about +/-0.05s accuracy. Thoughts?

content.raw: I believe we want the time of completion/failure. Also, depending on how the scoring works, that would likely affect the score.
content.html: I believe we want the time of completion/failure. Also, depending on how the scoring works, that would likely affect the score.

content.raw: so what do we want to know at higher than 1 Hz frequency?
content.html: so what do we want to know at higher than 1 Hz frequency?

content.raw: I like that for the most part. The only issue is that I spoke with Brian about it and he is concerned that 1Hz publishing for /vrx/task/info is not fast enough \(not enough resolution\). When I suggested simply dialing up the frequency, he said that he suspected that it would be resource-wasteful and an event-driven approach may be more effective for what we need. I think that we could try to just dial up the frequency as a simple solutions and see how it goes from there.
content.html: I like that for the most part. The only issue is that I spoke with Brian about it and he is concerned that 1Hz publishing for /vrx/task/info is not fast enough (not enough resolution). When I suggested simply dialing up the frequency, he said that he suspected that it would be resource-wasteful and an event-driven approach may be more effective for what we need. I think that we could try to just dial up the frequency as a simple solutions and see how it goes from there.

content.raw: Awesome, I like that OnFinished calls Exit\(\).
content.html: Awesome, I like that OnFinished calls Exit().

content.raw:
Hey Tyler, 

I think the better way to accomplish the last point is to bag the /vrx/task\_info toppic and pipe gazebo on verbose into a file then look for the“OnFinished” message. Also, with latest push OnFinished calls Exit\(\) which I believe provides the behavior that we want for all scoring plugins.
content.html:
Hey Tyler,

I think the better way to accomplish the last point is to bag the /vrx/task_info toppic and pipe gazebo on verbose into a file then look for the“OnFinished” message. Also, with latest push OnFinished calls Exit() which I believe provides the behavior that we want for all scoring plugins.

content.raw:
How it was done in ARIAC:

```
$ tail logs/example_team/sample/performance.log -n 25
(1518553810 6169392) [Dbg] [ROSAriacTaskManagerPlugin.cc:492] Sim time: 22
(1518553810 675725351) [Dbg] [ROSAriacTaskManagerPlugin.cc:717] Handle end service called
(1518553810 676916277) [Dbg] [ROSAriacTaskManagerPlugin.cc:579] End of trial. Final score: 0
Score breakdown:
<game_score>
Total game score: [0]
Total process time: [10.433]
Product travel time: [0]
<order_score order_0>
Total order score: [0]
Time taken: [10.432]
Complete: [false]
<shipment_score order_0_shipment_0>
Completion score: [0]
Complete: [false]
Submitted: [false]
Product presence score: [0]
All products bonus: [0]
Product pose score: [0]
</shipment_score>

</order_score>

</game_score>
```

Source code: [https://bitbucket.org/osrf/ariac/src/master/osrf\_gear/include/osrf\_gear/ARIAC.hh](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/ariac/src/master/osrf_gear/include/osrf_gear/ARIAC.hh)

content.raw:
I think the next things that are important are:

* Exiting on completion \(timed\_out==true\), in addition to going through gates in the wrong order
* Adding the appropriate end conditions for all tasks
* \(Probably future PR\) event driven check for end of task \(failure or success\), which gets the score and puts it into log
content.html:
I think the next things that are important are:

  • Exiting on completion (timed_out==true), in addition to going through gates in the wrong order
  • Adding the appropriate end conditions for all tasks
  • (Probably future PR) event driven check for end of task (failure or success), which gets the score and puts it into log

update.description:

update.title: Issue#139 gazebo ros shutdown

content.raw:
Demo:

`roslaunch vrx_gazebo navigation_task.launch verbose:=true`

Drive through the wrong gate or something to make the navigation\_scoring plugin call `this->Exit();` and see the errors:

`[Err] [scoring_plugin.cc:447] VRX_EXIT_ON_COMPLETION not set will not shutdown on ScoringPlugin::Exit()`

`[ERROR] [1563395856.034339775, 48.066000000]: VRX_EXIT_ON_COMPLETION not set, willnot shutdown on ScoringPlugin::Exit()`

Note: if not running on verbose, will only see the ROS\_ERROR.

close gazebo

`export VRX_EXIT_ON_COMPLETION="true"`

`roslaunch vrx_gazebo navigation_task.launch verbose:=true`

Drive through the wrong gate or something to make the navigation\_scoring plugin call `this->Exit();`

see gzserver and ros shutdown
content.html:
Demo:

roslaunch vrx_gazebo navigation_task.launch verbose:=true

Drive through the wrong gate or something to make the navigation_scoring plugin call this->Exit(); and see the errors:

[Err] [scoring_plugin.cc:447] VRX_EXIT_ON_COMPLETION not set will not shutdown on ScoringPlugin::Exit()

[ERROR] [1563395856.034339775, 48.066000000]: VRX_EXIT_ON_COMPLETION not set, willnot shutdown on ScoringPlugin::Exit()

Note: if not running on verbose, will only see the ROS_ERROR.

close gazebo

export VRX_EXIT_ON_COMPLETION="true"

roslaunch vrx_gazebo navigation_task.launch verbose:=true

Drive through the wrong gate or something to make the navigation_scoring plugin call this->Exit();

see gzserver and ros shutdown

content.raw:
I was able to fix the build issue, but still not able to make this work. It did not shut down or show me the desired ROS/gz msgs. I am not sure if I did something wrong, but I will keep looking into this.

`catkin_make`, `source ~/vrx_ws/devel/setup.zsh`, `roslaunch vrx_gazebo navigation_task.launch verbose:=true`

Hope to see `"VRX_EXIT_ON_COMPLETION not set, will not shutdown on ScoringPlugin::Exit()”`, but not. Only see \[msg\] OnFinish
